storyInfo: He's a good boy, and he's stubborn to a fault. He loses face, and he loses his living over it. He refuses to bow his head, but there are some problems you can't solve by repeatedly bashing yours against them.

attributes.content: Morning, Hung. Day off?
attributes.name: Passerby A

attributes.content: Hehe, something came up, so I had to call out.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Are you sick? You should go home and rest!
attributes.name: Passerby A

attributes.content: Nah, it's not that.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: So, how's your new job going?
attributes.name: Passerby A

attributes.content: (Whisper) Shh! That look on his face, I bet he got fired again.
attributes.name: Passerby B

attributes.content: (Whisper) Again? How many times has that been...? Kid's too nice and doesn't know how to be flexible.
attributes.name: Passerby A

attributes.content: (Whisper) You've got to be clever to make it these days.
attributes.name: Passerby A

attributes.content: (Whisper) Yeah, got to move with the times.
attributes.name: Passerby B

attributes.content: What did I tell you when you first showed up? Don't poke your nose where it doesn't belong!
attributes.name: Former Boss

attributes.content: Looks like you spent so much time at the top that your brain got addled from the lack of oxygen.
attributes.name: Former Boss

attributes.content: You gotta be flexible if you wanna do business in Lungmen!
attributes.name: Former Boss

attributes.content: You have any idea how much work it took to get this batch of goods?
attributes.name: Former Boss

attributes.content: And you threw it all out, just because you weren't sure of the source! Thank you very much, Mister Avatar of Justice!
attributes.name: Former Boss

attributes.content: Boss, this stuff's dangerous... what if it gets into the hands of the mafia?
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Who cares as long as they pay in gold and silver? Who do you think you are, trying to teach me how to do business?
attributes.name: Former Boss

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: But what? No buts. Get out, and don't let me see your face again.
attributes.name: Former Boss

attributes.content: Sorry, boss, I just...
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Get out! You're just like your dad. He deserved to be broke, and you deserve to be out on the street!
attributes.name: Former Boss

attributes.content: Boss, this has nothing to do with my dad...
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: GET LOST!
attributes.name: Former Boss

attributes.content: (Rumble—)
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: (Sigh... I should get something to eat, then I can think about what to do next.)
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Grand opening! 20% off during the opening promotion! Don't miss your chance to taste authentic Shangshu home cooking!
attributes.name: Street Ad

attributes.content: (Reaches for the wallet)
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: I think I have enough. Let's go.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Welcome! What can I get you?
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: Er, let me look at the menu.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: How about our signature item the 'Full House?' A set of meat and vegetable toppings. It's really great!
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: Thanks, but I'll just have a bowl of plain noodles.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Just plain noodles? No drink, no sides?
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: No, thanks. Just plain noodles.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Hmph. Fine, take a number and get in line.
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: ...Thanks.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: I'm looking to get a small bowl of noodles... any recommendations for a first timer?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: That would be our signature 'Full House.' Everyone loves it!
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: Sure, I'll take it.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Now that's what I like to hear. Here's your number, and I'll have it to you in a jiffy.
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: Alright then, thanks.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Hey, buddy, have you eaten here before? What do you think?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: No, this is my first time.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Ever had Shangshu food before?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: I had some when I was little, at a big restaurant with my dad. I loved it.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Haha. Bigger isn't always better when it comes to restaurants.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Here's your noodles, sir. Would love to hear your thoughts afterwards, good or bad.
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: Sure thing.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Excuse me, what about mine...?
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: You can't rush things, you know. Noodles take time.
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: But this gentleman's are ready. Why are mine taking longer?
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: What are you talking about? You didn't order the same type.
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: Young people these days have no patience. Good food takes time!
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: Ahem. Probably shouldn't keep your customers waiting, friend. You just opened, after all.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Huh? Oh, yeah, you're right, enjoy your meal.
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: (Nods in gratitude)
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Haha, don't mention it.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Phew...
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: (I guess I can wait a little longer.)
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: (The interior of this place looks pretty nice. I guess this is the Shangshu style.)
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: (When I was little, dad said we would go to Shangshu and really dig into the local cuisine... bah, no use thinking about it when he's not around anymore.)
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: (Hey, why is that guy peeking left and right?)
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: (He took out a paper packet... Wait, did he just pinch something into the bowl?)
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Hey, what are you doi—
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Hey, boss, what's going on here?!
attributes.name: Hoodlum

attributes.content: Is there a problem, sir?
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: There's a bug in this bowl! Look, a huge one, black and shiny.
attributes.name: Hoodlum

attributes.content: That's impossible. I hold myself to the highest standard of cleanliness.
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: Talk all you want! I got proof floating right there in this bowl!
attributes.name: Hoodlum

attributes.content: What are you trying to pull?! I've got cameras watching the shop, they'll prove you're just looking for trouble.
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: (Flips over the table) Huh? You want a fight?
attributes.name: Hoodlum

attributes.content: Busy with their argument, neither party notices that the bowl of noodles, which was launched into the air with the table, is headed straight for Lee.
Hm?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: (No rush. I can dodge it after another bite.)
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Ow, it burns!
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Are you ok, sir? Did any of the soup hit you?
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: I'm fine. You got a faceful of the hot noodle soup, though. Here, use this handkerchief.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: (Ack, I guess I owe him one now.)
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Hung shakes off the pieces of noodles and vegetables on his face, then wipes it with the handkerchief.
He holds the soiled cloth in his hand, not sure what to do. He looks over to Lee, seeing him point to the top of his head.
There's still something there.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Hung scratches his head, feels something hard in the fur, and pulls out a big, black, shiny bug.
You want a beating, huh?
attributes.name: Hoodlum

attributes.content: H-Hey, what are you doing?
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: I'm not playing word games with you anymore. The fist talks louder!
attributes.name: Hoodlum

attributes.content: Alright, I won't charge you for the noodles. How about that?
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: Are you kidding me? You think one bowl of noodles is gonna do it?
attributes.name: Hoodlum

attributes.content: Let... let me go, I can't breathe...
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: You—
attributes.name: Hoodlum

attributes.content: You heard him? Let him go!
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: And who do think you are? Go eat your noodles and stop poking your nose where it doesn't belong.
attributes.name: Hoodlum

attributes.content: Didn't you hear him? Let. Him. Go.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Looks like you want a beating too, eh?
attributes.name: Hoodlum

attributes.content: I... I'm sorry, it's all my fault, I won't do it again... please, let me go...
attributes.name: Hoodlum

attributes.content: Could you stop crying? You make it sound like I'm bullying you.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: (I hit him harder than I meant to. I hope he's okay...)
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Are you gonna be alright? Do you need a doctor?
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: (No way he really cares! He's making sure that I won't spill the beans on him!)
attributes.name: Hoodlum

attributes.content: Are... you alright?
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: I-I'm fine, I just fell down on my own, nothing to do with you at all, not a thing!
attributes.name: Hoodlum

attributes.content: Er... fell down? I thought I...
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: No, you weren't even there, don't worry, it's all my fault for being so clumsy, haha...
attributes.name: Hoodlum

attributes.content: I-I gotta go, bye!
attributes.name: Hoodlum

attributes.content: You're limping... just be careful, don't try to run too fast.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Thank you very much! Small businesses like ours always have a hard time.
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: You're not hurt, are you?
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Not at all, thanks to you.
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: (Rumble—)
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Er, sorry, but... are my noodles ready yet?
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Oh, how silly of me! Take a seat, and I'll be right up with your order.
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: Thanks, kid. A certain little girl would've chewed my head off if I went home with soiled clothes.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: You have a daughter, sir?
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Not exactly... well, I guess daughter's the best way to put it.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Oh? What do you mean?
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: It's a long story... say, you have some good moves. Who did you study with?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: I'm nothing special, just learned a couple things from my dad.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: I remember there was a guy who owned a security firm who used the same grappling technique. His surname escapes me at the moment...
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Ko. That's my father.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Yeah, that's it! How is he?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: He passed away last year.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Ah... I'm sorry to hear that.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: It's all in the past now, but thanks for the kind words.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Here's your noodles, sir. I added a bit of meat broth for you, a touch of extra flavor.
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: Oh... thank you.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: (Picks up chopsticks)
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Now...
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: (Puts down chopsticks) Is there something you wanted to say, sir?
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Well, you know, rent around here is high, and businesses are always barely scraping by.
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: Yes, I know...
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Sure, chasing away that hoodlum was a big help, but you also made a mess of the place while you were at it.
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: We ought to keep it separate, no? The noodles are for helping me out, which is one thing.
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: And the other?
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: About the mess you made... surely it's fair to ask that you pay for repairs?
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: (Tightens fist) I was only trying to help you...
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Hey now, what's with the fist?
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: You're gonna punch me? Looks like you're no better than that hoodlum, pushing people around just because you know kung fu.
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: No... I didn't mean to...
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Then pay up!
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: Sir, you shouldn't do this... it's not right...
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: What do you mean not right? Break something, pay for it. It's the proper way to do things.
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: You only took a couple of bites, dad... you're not gonna get better like this.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Oh, don't you worry. The guy in the next bed over already laughs at me for how over-protective my son is... *cough*, *cough*.
attributes.name: Sickly Man

attributes.content: Well, you shouldn't laugh with him, the way your lungs are. Anything else you want to eat? I can slice another apple for you. Hard to sleep on an empty stomach, after all.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: It's been a long time since I've had fried rice.
attributes.name: Sickly Man

attributes.content: Not sure that's a good idea. It'll give you indigestion and keep you up all night.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Worrying again. I was just kidding, Fine, fine, slice me up an apple.
attributes.name: Sickly Man

attributes.content: Alright...
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: How's working coming along? Has Old Li been yelling at you?
attributes.name: Sickly Man

attributes.content: It's going great. Uncle Li says I've got a great attitude.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Who do you think you're fooling? That long look on your face, I bet you got a good chewing out. No need to hide things from your dad, tell me the truth.
attributes.name: Sickly Man

attributes.content: Well... I got into an argument with Uncle Li. It's just not fair for him to mistreat his customers like that over a few coins.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Sigh, you're just like me, always so stubborn about doing the right thing. I paid my price; don't be like me.
attributes.name: Sickly Man

attributes.content: Why do you say that? You've always taught me right and wrong.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: And look where it got me! You're barely twenty, with your whole life ahead of you. No need to get yourself bruised and battered like me.
attributes.name: Sickly Man

attributes.content: What are you talking about, dad?!
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Listen to your father, Hei-sing. Sometimes, you have to let it go rather than banging your head against it forever.
attributes.name: Sickly Man

attributes.content: Daydreaming, kid? Like I said, the bill's fifteen thousand. How do you want to pay?
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: (Loosens fist)
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: ...I don't have a lot of money on me. Can I pay it by helping out around the shop?
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Ha, sure, wouldn't hurt to have some free labor. I'm sure you can put those muscles to use washing dishes. Meals and bed not included, just to be clear.
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: I'm done eating. I'll leave the cash here.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Thank you! Have a pleasant day, sir.
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: Oh, you said you wanted my thoughts, didn't you? Actually, I just found a big problem that I'd better share.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Appreciate it, sir, but I'm a little busy right now.
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: Sure, I can wait. Not sure if you can though.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Er... well, what is it, sir?
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: I was counting your fire extinguishers here while I was eating. I saw three.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: But if I'm not mistaken, we got some new regs last month that require a minimum of six for an establishment of this size, with a five thousand dollar fine per missing piece.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Let me run the numbers here real quick... comes out to fifteen thousand.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: The fire department's really cracking down on this stuff lately. One call, and the fire marshal's here in minutes. I do wonder if you'd have the time to sort things out.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: That sure is a pickle, isn't it?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: No need to beat around the bush, sir.
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: Given that you just opened, I think you should probably let it go. Trouble's bad for business.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: So you're here to play nice guy, eh? Don't you have better things to do than stick your nose where it doesn't belong?
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: Oh, but I think my nose very much belongs here. Fire safety is the responsibility of each and every Lungmen citizen, after all.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: You... how dare you...?
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: Fine, fine, whatever! Forget it, just get out, both of you!
attributes.name: Noodle Shop Owner

attributes.content: You heard the man. Let's go.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Thank you so much for helping me out, sir. I'm not sure how to repay your kindness, but if you ever need a pair of strong hands, I'm happy to help.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Ha, don't mention it. All I did was say a few words.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: S-Sir!
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Really, there's no need to thank me.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: N-No, it's not that.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Is there something else?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Could you... could you teach me?
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Teach you? What could I possibly teach you?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: I used to believe that right and wrong were as clear as black and white.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: But now, thinking back on things, I see only gray; where white ends and black starts, I just can't tell.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Oh? And why is that?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: There are so many people here in Lungmen. People looking for money, for justice, for life, for fun, for fame, for the truth... they all gather here.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Everyone has a different story, and everyone has their own ideas of right and wrong.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: When one person's right is another's wrong, they resort to violence and force their ideas on each other.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: What's right and wrong? Where's justice and fairness?
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Teach me what you know, sir. I don't want to keep banging my head until I bleed, but I also don't want to bow down to anyone.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: You're still young. It's natural you feel lost.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: But I can't teach you what you want to know...
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: I'm just one of the many people here in Lungmen, after all.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Sir, I...
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: (Rumble—)
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: ...But maybe I can teach you something else. Like how to make fried rice that tastes just right.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Fried rice?
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Yeah. How about it?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: I... Yes. Thank you, sir.
attributes.name: Hung

attributes.content: Let's go, then. We can get some spring onions and eggs from the market on the way.
attributes.name: Lee
